intro: Carvi flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible caraway, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Carvi flexuosum is often found in meadows and along woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
